conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring patient health data only with consent, enforcing privacy constraints, while User Story B demands sharing all exercise progress openly without privacy restrictions, which forbids limiting data sharing under any circumstances.
userStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data with their consent, so that I can prioritize care effectively.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to receive challenging exercise suggestions and share all my progress openly without privacy restrictions, so I can push my limits and stay motivated.
cluster: Strict Privacy Control over Data Sharing
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story B is updated to respect privacy constraints by sharing exercise progress only with consent, while User Story A remains unchanged to enforce monitoring with consent.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data with their consent, so that I can prioritize care effectively.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to receive challenging exercise suggestions and share my progress openly only with consent, so I can stay motivated while protecting my privacy.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring patient health data only with consent, effectively forbidding data sharing without consent, while User Story B demands ALFRED to share all health data freely without restrictions, creating a direct opposition on data sharing conditions.
userStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data with their consent, so that I can prioritize care effectively.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to share all my health data freely so I feel motivated and supported without restrictions.
cluster: Strict Privacy Control over Data Sharing
resolutionDescription: Refine both user stories to enforce data sharing only with consent, while allowing motivated users to opt-in for broader sharing, balancing privacy and openness.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data only with patient consent, so that care is prioritized respecting privacy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to freely share my health data with consent, so that I feel motivated and supported.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring patient health data with consent, which implies sending reminders or alerts related to health monitoring, while User Story B forbids most reminders to avoid overwhelming the older adult, creating a conflict between performing monitoring operations that may trigger reminders and forbidding reminders altogether.
userStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data with their consent, so that I can prioritize care effectively.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to dismiss almost all reminders from ALFRED, so I can avoid feeling overwhelmed and keep my day under control.
cluster: Strict Privacy Control over Data Sharing
resolutionDescription: Balance monitoring and reminders by specifying reminders occur only with user consent and are minimally intrusive to avoid overwhelming the older adult.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data and send minimal reminders with user consent, so that care is prioritized effectively without overwhelming.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to dismiss most reminders and receive only essential alerts, so I can avoid feeling overwhelmed and maintain control.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires automatic logging of vital data only with patient consent (implying a restriction), while User Story B wants all health data shared freely without restrictions. These opposing expectations on data sharing behavior constitute a Start-Forbid conflict.
userStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want vital data to be automatically logged with patient consent, so I can access accurate clinical information promptly.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to share all my health data freely so I feel motivated and supported without restrictions.
cluster: Strict Privacy Control over Data Sharing
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to clarify that vital data logging occurs only with explicit patient consent, while User Story B is maintained to express the desire for unrestricted data sharing, highlighting the need for configurable consent management.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want vital data logged only with patient consent, so I can access accurate clinical information securely.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to share all my health data freely so I feel motivated and supported without restrictions.

conflictDescription: User Story A forbids non-emergency app reminders during work hours to avoid distractions, while User Story B wants all health data shared freely to enable motivation and support, which implies allowing reminders or notifications. These requirements conflict because one mandates blocking notifications while the other expects unrestricted data sharing that likely leads to reminders.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to block all non-emergency app reminders during work hours, so I can focus solely on urgent patient care without distractions.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to share all my health data freely so I feel motivated and supported without restrictions.
cluster: Strict Privacy Control over Data Sharing
resolutionDescription: Adjust both user stories to clarify that non-emergency reminders are blocked during work hours while allowing health data sharing without triggering reminders in those periods to avoid conflict.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to block non-emergency app reminders during work hours, so I can avoid distractions while providing urgent care.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to share all my health data freely outside work hours, so I feel motivated and supported without distractions.

userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to receive challenging exercise suggestions and share all my progress openly without privacy restrictions, so I can push my limits and stay motivated.
